channel.title: Question about hyperion
channel.description: Is it possible to Change quests names?

item.title: Question about hyperion
item.dc:creator: @ou08tlaw ou08tlaw
item.description:
@ou08tlaw wrote:

[quote=“Onix, post:4, topic:464209”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=568065.msg4125163#msg4125163 date=1350297463]

Yes. Try looking in some of the interface classes or ‘actionsenders’ etc. If the quest names are the default then you will have to write the code for sending the information to the client, preferably upon login.

Yes, but that also decreases login speed.

Use Lin’s interface editor/emulator: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,427639.msg3733252.html#msg3733252
Works great for me, just gotta get the hang of using it.
[/quote]Most servers don’t get finished, and fewer make it big. Mostly people do it for fun for themselves and sometimes friends, so a short delay with logging in won’t really make that much of a difference for them, unless they are changing a lot of crap and having the packets spammed to the client.

But feel free to use that if you feel you need it. I think it’s a lot simpler. But it’s really up to you ou08tlaw.[/quote]
Thanks you guys for the help

Read full topic

item.title: Question about hyperion
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:3, topic:464209”][quote author=Onix link=topic=568065.msg4125145#msg4125145 date=1350292068]
Yes. Try looking in some of the interface classes or ‘actionsenders’ etc. If the quest names are the default then you will have to write the code for sending the information to the client, preferably upon login.
[/quote]
Yes, but that also decreases login speed.

Use Lin’s interface editor/emulator: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,427639.msg3733252.html#msg3733252
Works great for me, just gotta get the hang of using it.[/quote]Most servers don’t get finished, and fewer make it big. Mostly people do it for fun for themselves and sometimes friends, so a short delay with logging in won’t really make that much of a difference for them, unless they are changing a lot of crap and having the packets spammed to the client.

But feel free to use that if you feel you need it. I think it’s a lot simpler. But it’s really up to you ou08tlaw.

Read full topic
